abstract: Mr. Jackson said he was working with Damien Echols to see him fully exonerated of a 1994 murder conviction. Mr. Echols and two other Arkansas men were recently released from prison following a deal that required them to plead guilty even as they continue to maintain their innocence.

lead_paragraph: At a news conference on Friday in New Zealand Peter Jackson, the director of the "Lord of the Rings" trilogy and a coming two-part film adaptation of "The Hobbit," said he was working with one of the recently released Arkansas men known as the West Memphis Three to help get him exonerated of the crimes for which the three spent nearly 20 years in prison.

headline.main: Peter Jackson Says He'll Help One of the West Memphis Three Seek a Pardon
